Article Title: IPL 2024: MS Dhoni becomes first player to make this big record in Chennai Super Kings' win against Sunrisers Hyderabad
Article Text:
|

|

NEW DELHI: Chennai Super Kings ' talisman MS Dhoni added another feather to his glittering cap as his team defeated Sunrisers Hyderabad by 78 runs at Chepauk in Chennai on Sunday.Dhoni, the former CSK captain, became the first player to register 150th IPL win as his team moved up to the third spot in the points table with their fifth victory in nine games.Overall, Dhoni has played 259 IPL matches scoring 5178 runs at a strike rate of 137.13 hitting 24 half-centuries.Dhoni has the second highest batting strike rate of 259.46 and is yet to be dismissed in this edition with 96 runs in 9 matches and 7 innings.Against SRH on Sunday, Dhoni came in to bat with only 4 balls left in the CSK innings and smashed the first ball from T Natarajan for a four and then took a single off the nest ball to remain unbeaten yet again.Dhoni one of the most iconic cricketers in the history of IPL, is widely known for his leadership skills, calm demeanor under pressure, and exceptional finishing abilities in limited-overs cricket.Dhoni has been associated with the CSK since the inception of the IPL in 2008, and he has played a crucial role in the team's success over the years.As a captain, Dhoni led CSK to five IPL titles, establishing the team as one of the most successful franchises in the tournament. His tactical acumen and ability to make crucial decisions on the field have been instrumental in CSK's consistent performances.Off the field, Dhoni's popularity transcends cricket, making him a cultural icon and a beloved figure among cricket fans in India and around the world. His contributions to Indian cricket, both in terms of leadership and batting prowess, have earned him immense respect and admiration.
Article Summary: Dhoni became the first player to register 150th IPL win as his team moved up to the third spot in the points table with their fifth victory in nine games. He has the second highest batting strike rate of 259.46 and is yet to be dismissed in this edition with 96 runs in 9 matches and 7 innings.

Article Title: Virat Kohli: 'Shoulder push and smile': Virat Kohli and Shubman Gill's playful banter steals the show in GT vs RCB IPL clash
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Royal Challengers Bengaluru showcased a commanding performance against Gujarat Titans in the ongoing IPL 2024 campaign at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad, clinching a crucial victory to keep their playoff hopes alive.While RCB's triumph was highlighted by Virat Kohli 's sensational batting display, it was the friendly tussle between Kohli and Gujarat Titans' captain Shubman Gill that stole the spotlight.IPL 2024: POINTS TABLE Chasing a challenging target of 201, RCB's chase was led by a masterclass innings from Kohli, who remained unbeaten on 70 off 44 balls. Kohli's aggressive approach, particularly against spinners, showcased his prowess and silenced any doubts regarding his strike rate. His partnership with Will Jacks was pivotal in RCB's emphatic victory, with Jacks contributing an unbeaten 41-ball century to seal the win with nine wickets in hand.However, amidst Kohli's batting brilliance, it was his playful exchanges and friendly banter with Shubman Gill that added an intriguing subplot to the match. Kohli's antics, including interrupting Gill during his captaincy stint and teasing him with a shoulder push, provided entertainment for fans both on and off the field. Despite attempts to maintain focus, Gill couldn't help but respond with a smile and engage in light-hearted exchanges with Kohli.Their camaraderie was evident throughout the match, with Kohli even walking up to Gill near the boundary ropes for a friendly chat during Gujarat Titans' innings. The interaction between the two star players showcased a blend of competitiveness and mutual respect, highlighting the camaraderie that exists among players in the IPL.Kohli's performance not only propelled RCB to victory but also marked a significant milestone as he reached 500 runs in the season, further solidifying his reputation as one of the league's top performers.Kohli's post-match remarks emphasized his focus on team success and his unwavering confidence in his abilities, shutting down any criticisms regarding his approach to the game.
Article Summary: Royal Challengers Bengaluru beat Gujarat Titans by nine wickets. Virat Kohli's unbeaten 70 helped RCB to victory. Kohli and Shubman Gill engaged in friendly tussle on and off the field. Will Jacks scored an unbeaten 41-ball century to seal the win.

Article Title: T20 World Cup selection: Too many loose ends
Article Text:
Agarkar-led selection panel has a tough job to do

Third opener and second wicketkeeper

Sticking with tried and tested seam attack

Power game in the middle

NEW DELHI: With the deadline to announce the teams for the upcoming T20 World Cup fast approaching, the selection committee and the team management have been working overtime to strike the right combination.By no means, this is going to be a straightforward selection for the Ajit Agarkar-led selection committee.He was in the Capital on Saturday to watch the match between Delhi Capitals and Mumbai Indians. It is speculated that Agarkar had an informal meeting with Rohit Sharma about the team.According to sources, there are three major contentious issues that need to be resolved before BCCI secretary Jay Shah convenes the meeting to formally announce the 15-member team. The team is slated to leave for the World Cup on May 21 with the players who will be out of the IPL by then.TOI understands that the selectors are torn between Sanju Samson and KL Rahul for the second wicketkeeper-batsman slot with Rishabh Pant having done enough to prove his fitness and form to be the first choice for this position.Rahul's intent at the top of the order has always been debatable. However, as the ongoing IPL season has progressed, the picture has changed with two young openers - Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shubman Gill - looking off the boil. Both Rahul and Samson's international records are not great. But Gill, with his struggling form in the IPL, doesn't command automatic selection yet.This is where Rahul could pip Samson in the race even though Samson has been having a dream season while leading Rajasthan Royals. Rahul's experience at the top of the order and his willingness to bat in the middle order gives him a chance.With Mohammed Shami injured, the Indian seam attack suddenly looks shaky. The IPL has been particularly cruel on the bowlers with team totals touching unprecedented highs. Sources told TOI that the team management wants to stick with the lot which has been part of the setup for the last two-three years even though. Arshdeep Singh and Mohammed Siraj have gone for around nine runs per over so far in the IPL."The team management wants to trust the players it has groomed. There are concerns about Siraj and Arshdeep going for so many runs but one has to look at the context. In these matches, you have to think about defending the target set by your team-even if you do it by 10 runs. Jasprit Bumrah is different class. The others should not be compared with him. There won't be 'impact player' rule in the World Cup. Axar Patel, for example, has been exemplary with his economy rate," the source told TOI.Bowlers who could give them competition are Avesh Khan and Mukesh Kumar who have been growing into the role of bowling the tough overs. The selectors will have to decide if they want to go in with an extra spinner Ravi Bishnoi or the extra pacer because Hardik Pandya's seam bowling can't be ignored. Bishnoi is seen as someone who can bowl at any stage of an innings.The biggest challenge will be to have the power hitters in the middle order. Rohit and Virat Kohli have been steady run-getters but the onus to post humongous scores will fall on power-hitters in the middle and late middle-order. The striking abilities of Hardik and Ravindra Jadeja have not been very inspiring.The team management had groomed Rinku Singh for that role. Shivam Dube has also emerged as an option. But him not bowling enough may pull him down a bit. Sources say the selection committee isn't keen on getting swayed by IPL performances but someone like Tilak Varma can't be ruled out.
Article Summary: The deadline to announce the teams for the upcoming T20 World Cup fast approaching. The team is slated to leave for the World Cup on May 21 with the players who will be out of the IPL by then. The selectors are torn between Sanju Samson and KL Rahul for the second wicketkeeper-batsman slot.

Article Title: IPL 2024: In his public criticism of Tilak Varma, has Hardik Pandya failed another leadership test?
Article Text:
|

|

Hardik Pandya 's elevation to the Mumbai Indians captaincy has not gone down too well with the loyal fans of the five-time champions as he replaced the highly successful Rohit Sharma , a bonafide India legend and also the all-format national team captain.While some of the booing and hooting at the Wankhede has been toxic and unnecessary, the skipper has not done too much on the field to change the perceptions about him off it.Not bowling Jasprit Bumrah straight up, changing the playing XI repeatedly, changing his own batting slot constantly, he has shown all signs of a confused and a stressed leader. What's worse, it doesn't seem as if he has the dressing room pulling in one direction.What many felt was needless after the team's 10-run loss to Delhi Capitals was his criticism of Tilak Varma , the team's top run scorer with 63 off 32 balls, saying his lack of intent against Axar Patel cost MI the game."Axar bowling to a left-hander (read Tilak), the better option could have been to go after him," Hardik told the official broadcasters after the game. "I think it was just a little game awareness that we missed out. At the end of the day, that cost us the game."Really? Let's analyse. Axar Patel bowled six balls to the promising left-hander off which he scored 14 runs. He had bowled to Tilak when MI had scored 72 for 3. Hardik was batting with Axar in the middle as MI had lost the wicket ofSuryakumar Yadav with the team score at 65.Tilak scored four off four balls off Axar in an attempt to momentarily consolidate till Hardik got his eye in. Once the partnership was set, he hit Axar for a six and a four prompting DC skipper Rishabh Pant to take him out of the attack.Moreover, if Hardik wanted Tilak to attack, wasn't he the best man to tell him as he was in the middle?If the skipper really wants to look at the reasons for MI's loss on Saturday, may be a closer look at his bowling figures 2-0-41-0 and the decision in sending an in-form Tim David out to bat at No. 7 on a small ground, may provide those.Picking on a youngster scouted and groomed by the franchise and an ex-skipper's favourite, won't help.
Article Summary: Hardik Pandya's elevation to the Mumbai Indians captaincy has not gone down too well with the loyal fans of the five-time champions. Some of the booing and hooting at the Wankhede has been toxic and unnecessary. He has not done too much on the field to change the perceptions about him off it.

Article Title: Yesterday IPL match: Ruturaj Gaikwad, Tushar Deshpande shine in Chennai Super Kings' 78-run win over Sunrisers Hyderabad
Article Text:
(With inputs from PTI)

NEW DELHI: Captain Ruturaj Gaikwad 's aggressive 98, paired with a precise bowling performance led by pacer Tushar Deshpande , guided the Chennai Super Kings to a 78-run victory over the Sunrisers Hyderabad in the Indian Premier League on Sunday.After being invited to bat, Gaikwad's impressive 54-ball innings powered CSK to a formidable 212 for three. He was supported by Daryl Mitchell 's return to form, contributing a key 52 off 32 balls, while Shivam Dube added an unbeaten 39 off 20 balls to push CSK past the 200 mark.In response, SRH's overly cautious batting approach failed once again as they couldn't recover from Deshpande's (4/27 in 3 overs) early three-wicket burst and the subsequent pressure in the middle overs, ultimately being bowled out for 134 in 18.5 overs. This win ended CSK's two-game losing streak.With the victory, CSK climbed to third place with 10 points, the same as the Kolkata Knight Riders, Lucknow Super Giants, and Delhi Capitals. SRH, also with 10 points, fell to fourth after their fourth loss.Chasing 213 to win, Travis Head (13) and Abhishek Sharma (15) made rapid starts but Deshpande got rid of the former with a slower wide ball and then returned to remove impact sub Anmolpreet Singh with an outswinger on the stumps as the batter went for a golden duck.Abhishek was next caught at deep point as Deshpande broke their back, leaving SRH at 40 for 3 in the fourth over.Nitish Reddy (15) and Aiden Markram (32) tried to steady the ship but Ravindra Jadeja bamboozled the former with a bouncer, while Matheesha Pathirana produced a superb yorker to uproot the middle stump of the South African.At 85-5 in 10.5 overs, Heinrich Klaasen and Abdul Samad joined hands but runs were tough to come by as the bowlers executed their plans to perfectly.While Jadeja completed a superb spell of 4-0-22-1, Shardul Thakur kept bowling at wide outside off to frustrate the batters as CSK conceded just two boundaries in nine overs after the powerplay.With an improbable 104 needed off 30 balls, Klaasen, Samad, Pat Cummins and Shahbaz Ahmed all holed out as Mitchell claimed five catches in the outfield during the match.Earlier, Gaikwad missed out on a successive hundred by a whisker but his 107-run stand with Mitchell was the cornerstone of CSK's innings. It is CSK's 35th 200-plus total, the most by any side in T20 cricket.Gaikwad was the star of the CSK batting as he hit 10 fours and three sixes in his innings.Opening the innings, Ajinkya Rahane (9) perished early again with Bhuvneshwar Kumar earning his prized wicket in the third over but Gaikwad kept CSK going. The skipper did not back down and attacked the bowlers at will as the hosts ended the powerplay at 50 for one.In no time, the 27-year-old Gaikwad brought up his 17th IPL half-century off just 27 deliveries.Gaikwad and Mitchell batted sensibly as they managed to keep the boundaries coming, with the latter chipping in periodically too after a slow start (12 off 11).With dew setting in the 12th over, the batting duo tried to take advantage of it as Mitchell soon brought up his maiden IPL 50 off 29 deliveries in the 13th over.But the New Zealander failed to get going for too long and perished in the following over to Jaydev Unadkat after depositing a full-toss into the hands of Nitish Kumar Reddy in the deep mid-wicket.In-form Shivam Dube then joined Gaikwad and the two decided to up the ante. SRH skipper Pat Cummins was targeted by the batters, having been dispatched for 49 in his four overs.Gaikwad looked set to back-to-back tons but the heat and humidity of Chennai seemed to affect him as his vigil ended with a tired-looking shot as T Natarajan sent him back in the final over.Crowd-favourite MS Dhoni scored five off two deliveries that included a four, while Dube deposited a full toss in the stands as the final four overs yielded 53 runs.
Article Summary: Chennai Super Kings beat Sunrisers Hyderabad by 78 runs. Captain Ruturaj Gaikwad top scored with 98 off 54 balls. Daryl Mitchell made 52 off 32 balls. Shivam Dube added 39 off 20 balls to push CSK past 200 mark.

Article Title: 'I was pissed off...': Virat Kohli and Will Jacks' dressing room chat after RCB's victory - WATCH
Article Text:
WATCH:

NEW DELHI: Will Jacks notched up a breathtaking century, while Virat Kohli stepped up during the middle overs as the Royal Challengers Bengaluru outclassed the Gujarat Titans by nine wickets in the IPL 2024 match at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad on Sunday.Virat (70 not out off 44 balls), who faced criticism for his approach in the middle overs in the previous game, used the sweep shot effectively against the spinners to make his mark.Jacks (100 not out off 41 balls) then took control, dominating the chase and securing the 201-run target with 24 balls to spare.Jacks unleashed a relentless attack in what turned out to be the final over of the game, hitting four sixes and a four off Rashid Khan, ending the match much earlier than anticipated. His astonishing performance included 10 sixes.After the game, RCB posted a captivating video on their social media of Virat engaging in a conversation with Jacks about his outstanding innings.With one run needed to win and 6 for his century, Jacks sent Rashid Khan over deep midwicket for a six, reaching his hundred and securing victory for RCB in style.RCB, who are languishing at the bottom of the points tally, claimed their third win in 10 matches.RCB will next face Gujarat Titans once again on May 4.
Article Summary: Royal Challengers Bengaluru beat Gujarat Titans by nine wickets in IPL 2024 match. Will Jacks scores 100 as RCB secure 201-run target with 24 balls to spare. Virat Kohli scores 70 not out for RCB. RCB claim third win in 10 matches.

Article Title: 'My family's life changed…': KKR star Rinku Singh reveals special meaning of his tattoo
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Kolkata Knight Riders star Rinku Singh shared a personal story on the Knights Dugout Podcast, explaining the significance of the tattoo on his right arm which is very meaningful to him.Rinku, who has been a crucial player for KKR, revealed that the tattoo on his right arm holds a special meaning for him. It was etched into his skin when he was selected for the KKR team, marking a pivotal moment at 2:20 PM that turned his family's fortunes around."This was made when I was picked for KKR.I think it was 2:20 PM. My family's life changed from that very point. I was auctioned for Rs 80 lakh. So the money solved all the family problems. We could repay all the debt. So my life changed from then," said the 26-year-old batter.The tattoo has the word 'family' inked on it, along with a rose and a peace symbol. Rinku's journey to becoming a professional cricketer has not been easy, and his tattoo is a reminder of the struggles and the eventual success that has come his way.Explaining his tattoo, Rinku added, "I have inked the word family here, a rose, and a symbol of peace."SEE ALSO: IPL 2024 POINTS TABLE On a lighter note, Rinku also talked about an amusing incident involving a monkey. He humorously recounted how a monkey bit him six times, suggesting that the monkey might have taken a liking to him.He admitted, "Monkey had bitten me six times. It was the same monkey. I think he fell in love with me."On the cricket front, Rinku continues to be an important asset for his team with a total of 112 runs from eight innings. KKR fans are hopeful that Rinku will bring his best game to the field in the upcoming matches.Following the defeat to Punjab Kings, Kolkata Knight Riders are set to face the Delhi Capitals in their next IPL 2024 season match at the Eden Gardens Stadium on Monday.
Article Summary: Kolkata Knight Riders star Rinku Singh shared a personal story on the Knights Dugout Podcast. The 26-year-old revealed that the tattoo on his right arm holds a special meaning for him. It was etched into his skin when he was selected for the KKR team.

Article Title: Run-machine Virat Kohli equals David Warner's massive IPL record, becomes first batter this season to...
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Royal Challengers Bengaluru 's star Virat Kohli on Sunday breached the 500-run mark in the ongoing Indian Premier League IPL ), becoming the first batter to do so this season.The Orange cap holder of the season, Virat Kohli got the feat in the game against Gujarat Titans in Ahmedabad.Kohli, who needed 70 runs to get to the feat, scored the exact same number of runs in RCB 's third win of the season.With Kohli getting to the 500-run mark in a season, the RCB opener joined David Warner on the list of most 500-plus run seasons in IPL.Both have now scored 500-plus runs in a season on 7 occasions.Shikhar Dhawan and KL Rahul have had 500-plus run seasons on 5 occasions.Kohli so far has scored 4 fifties and a hundred in IPL 2024 and his runs have come at a strike rate of over 147. The run machine averages a staggering 71.43.With 500 runs in the bag, Kohli is quite ahead of the competitors with Titans' Sai Sudharsan -- 428 runs -- at second spot.Rajasthan Royals' Sanju Samson (385), Lucknow Super Giants' KL Rahul (378) and Rishabh Pant (371) of Delhi Capitals complete the top 5 of the list of highest-run-getters this IPL season.Will Jacks struck a stunning hundred, while Kohli's 70 not out powered RCB to a dominating nine-wicket win over the Titans.Opener Kohli and one-down Jacks (100 not out) shared 166 runs for the unbroken second wicket to overhaul the target of 201 with 24 balls to spare.RCB reached 206 for 1 in 16 overs.Earlier, Gujarat Titans posted 200 for 3 after being invited to bat.Sudharsan (84 not out) and M Shahrukh Khan (58) struck fifties to take GT to the 200-run mark.
Article Summary: Royal Challengers Bengaluru's Virat Kohli becomes first to score 500 runs in IPL this season. Kohli scored 70 not out in RCB's nine-wicket win over Gujarat Titans. He joins David Warner and Shikhar Dhawan on list of most 500-plus run seasons.

Article Title: 'It is all about TRPs, media has got no clue…': Gautam Gambhir on hype around his relationship with Virat Kohli
Article Text:
Virat Kohli and Gautam Gambhir (PTI)

NEW DELHI: Former Indian cricketer Gautam Gambhir provided perspectives on his relationship with Virat Kohli and the nuances of on-field conduct, shedding light on the complexities inherent in their interactions both within and beyond the cricketing arena.Gambhir remarked on the media's role in shaping public perceptions, highlighting the tendency to sensationalize narratives for the sake of ratings. IPL 2024: POINTS TABLE "It is all about TRPs. Media has got no clue what kind of a person I am, what kind of a person Virat is. All the media wants to do is create hype. But hype can also be created in a positive way," Gambhir observed, underscoring the impact of media coverage on public opinion."I absolutely second what Virat said. Logon ka masala nahi mila toh (The gossip bit is over for people). As I said, when two people are mature enough, I don't think so anyone has got any right to interfere between two people's life or their relationships because ultimately, it is between two of them," Gambhir added on the subject.Addressing his lighter side, Gambhir humorously acknowledged Kohli's dance prowess, quipping, "Even if I want to, I cannot pull off even one move. So if I had to learn something from Virat, it would be his dance moves," showcasing the camaraderie shared between the two cricketers.On the contentious issue of Kohli's strike rate, Gambhir echoed sentiments expressed by the Indian captain, emphasizing the contextual nature of performance metrics."Every player has a different game. What Maxwell can do, Kohli cannot and what Kohli can do, Maxwell cannot. You need to have different types of batters in your XI. If from No.1 to No.8 you stack it up with explosive batters, you may score 300 but also get bowled out for 30," Gambhir asserted, highlighting the diversity of playing styles within a team.Expanding on the significance of strike rate, Gambhir underscored its correlation with match dynamics and situational factors."When you win, even a strike rate of 100 is good. But when you lose despite having a strike rate of 180, no one talks about it. That is the reality," Gambhir elucidated, offering a nuanced perspective on performance evaluation in cricket.Earlier, Kohli responded to criticisms surrounding his changed on-field demeanor, particularly in light of recent displays of sportsmanship. Reflecting on past altercations, Kohli dismissed detractors' disappointment, quipping, "People are very disappointed with my behavior. I hugged Naveen, and then the other day Gauti bhai [Gautam Gambhir] hugged me. Now that they don't have anything juicy, they've started booing. We are not kids!"
Article Summary: Former Indian cricketer Gautam Gambhir provides perspectives on his relationship with Virat Kohli. The pair shed light on the complexities inherent in their interactions both within and beyond the cricketing arena. Kohli responded to criticisms surrounding his changed on-field demeanor, particularly in light of recent sportsmanship.

Article Title: No Sanju Samson, no Hardik Pandya: This former cricketer's India T20 World Cup squad has many surprises
Article Text:
Simon Doull's Team India squad for T20 World Cup

India Playing XI:

On the bench:

NEW DELHI: Former New Zealand cricketer Simon Doull has stirred the pot with his preferred India squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup , notably excluding Sanju Samson from his lineup despite Rajasthan Royals captain's recent heroics in the IPL 2024.Doull's selection conundrum mirrors the dilemma facing Ajit Agarkar-led selectors, particularly regarding the two wicket-keeping positions for the World Cup squad.While Rishabh Pant remains the frontrunner, the backup role has sparked a debate, with contenders including Samson, KL Rahul, and Dinesh Karthik.Speaking to Cricbuzz, Doull unveiled his preferred combination, slotting Pant as the first-choice keeper and Rahul as the backup. However, the intriguing twist came with Doull's decision to assign Pant the No. 3 batting position, a move aimed at accommodating other players in the lineup."I have flipped and flopped a lot about this, but I want Rishabh Pant at No. 3 because I can't see fitting the other players in without my keeper batting at No. 3. Also, I wanted a left-hander followed by two righties," Doull explained, shedding light on his strategic approach.Despite Pant's T20I struggles, Doull expressed confidence in the Delhi Capitals captain's evolution and emphasized his improved fitness during the IPL 2024 season.Meanwhile, Doull's preference for Shivam Dube over Hardik Pandya, based on Dube's impressive batting displays for Chennai Super Kings further complicated the selection dynamics.In Doull's starting XI for India, Virat Kohli features as the opener alongside Yashasvi Jaiswal as the backup. The squad includes Ravindra Jadeja as the lone all-rounder, with expectations for Dube to contribute with his bowling skills.Additionally, Doull opted for Arshdeep Singh as the third seamer, with Avesh Khan serving as the backup option in the pace department.Rohit Sharma , Virat Kohli, Rishabh Pant, Suryakumar Yadav, Shivam Dube, Rinku Singh, Ravindra Jadeja, Kuldeep Yadav, Jasprit Bumrah, Mohammed Siraj, Arshdeep SinghKL Rahul, Avesh Khan, Yashasvi Jaiswal, Axar Patel
Article Summary: Former New Zealand cricketer Simon Doull has named his preferred India squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup. Doull's selection conundrum mirrors the dilemma facing Ajit Agarkar-led selectors, particularly regarding the two wicket-keeping positions for the World Cup squad.

Article Title: Sanju Samson: 'He has to be on that aeroplane': Sanju Samson's explosive IPL form reignites T20 World Cup selection debate
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Rajasthan Royals skipper Sanju Samson has played a stunning knock against Lucknow Super Giants, garnering support from veteran cricketers for his inclusion in the India’s T20 World Cup squad .In an IPL match on Saturday at the Ekana Stadium, Samson's breathtaking performance not only secured a crucial victory for Rajasthan Royals but also reignited discussions surrounding his selection for the upcoming ICC event.Former England cricketer Kevin Pietersen wasted no time in advocating for Samson's inclusion, delivering a blunt message to BCCI chief selector Ajit Agarkar moments after the match-winning six against Lucknow.Pietersen, speaking on Star Sports, emphasized Samson's undeniable talent and his ability to thrive under pressure, asserting that he must be a part of the World Cup squad."He has to go. There's no doubt in my mind that he has to be on that aeroplane to the Caribbean and the USA in a couple of weeks. He is doing a lot with the pressure that he is also under as a captain and not being given higher honours. The way he scores runs and the situation he bats in, if I was the selector, he is one of my first picks," Pietersen declared emphatically.Amidst ongoing discussions regarding the T20 World Cup squad selection, Samson's consistent batting performances throughout the IPL season have bolstered his case for inclusion. With an unbeaten 71 off just 33 balls against LSG, including seven boundaries and four maximums, Samson showcased his ability to deliver under pressure, taking his season tally to an impressive 385 runs with four fifty-plus scores.Samson also currently leads the run-scoring charts among all Indian wicket-keeping options in IPL 2024 and stands second in the race for the Orange Cap , further solidifying his credentials for the World Cup squad.
Article Summary: Rajasthan Royals skipper Sanju Samson has played a stunning knock against Lucknow Super Giants, garnering support for his inclusion in the India’s T20 World Cup squad. Kevin Pietersen wasted no time in advocating for Samson's inclusion, delivering a blunt message to BCCI chief selector Ajit Agarkar.

Article Title: 'Never felt fatigued...': MS Dhoni shares the secret of staying fresh during IPL - Watch
Article Text:
|

|

NEW DELHI: Even at the age of 42, MS Dhoni has taken the IPL by storm and at the moment, there is no indication that this edition will be his last.Dhoni has the second highest batting strike rate of 260.00 and is yet to be dismissed in this edition with 91 runs in 8 matches and 6 innings.As Chennai Super Kings gear up to face Sunrisers Hyderabad on Sunday, the host broadcaster shared a video of the CSK talisman talking about his secret of staying fresh in the IPL.Dhoni says, "According to some of them it was one of the most absurd time-table one could have but over the years it only helped me. Five-seven days before the IPL starts, I would start thinking like that and I would start training my mind like that. The plus point we had that we used to try to catch the flight that was after 12.""What I used to do is that I would sleep very late because when the matches are on, from 8 to 11-11.30 is the schedule, after that post-match presentations then you would pack your kit bag, there would be late dinner. By the time you reach back to the hotel, it's almost 1-1:15. After that you have to pack your belongings in the hotel, leave the kit bag outside and by the time you do all of that, it's pretty late, let's say around 2:30," Dhoni adds."So instead of sleeping from 10 pm to 6 am or 11 pm to 7 am, I would sleep from 3 am to 11 am. So the minimum 8 hours sleep that I need, that I have to do for sure. I was always well-rested at night, never felt fatigued after the IPL got over," Dhoni concludes.Coming at the fag end of CSK innings, Dhoni has not only played to the gallery but also scored crucial runs for his team while delighting fans with his trademark big shots.CSK are at the sixth spot in the points table with 4 wins and 4 defeats in 8 matches.
Article Summary: Dhoni has the second highest batting strike rate of 260.00 and is yet to be dismissed in this edition. CSK are at the sixth spot in the points table with 4 wins and 4 defeats in 8 matches. Chennai Super Kings face Sunrisers Hyderabad on Sunday.

Article Title: Watch: Dhruv Jurel celebrates maiden IPL fifty with family after Rajasthan Royals' victory against Lucknow Super Giants
Article Text:
|

|

NEW DELHI: Dhruv Jurel , who was promoted up the order, justified the decision with an unbeaten 34-ball 52 as Rajasthan Royals defeated Lucknow Super Giants by 7 wickets to consolidate their top position and took a giant stride towards IPL 2024 playoffs.Jurel hit 2 sixes and 5 fours in his knock and put up an unbeaten 121-run stand with his skipper Sanju Samson (71*) as the Royals chased down the 197-run target with an over to spare in Lucknow on Saturday to keep their unbeaten away streak intact.After the match, the official X handle of the Indian Premier League shared a heart-warming video of Jurel celebrating his maiden IPL fifty with his family.On being asked after the match about the salute celebration after half-century, Jurel said he dedicated his milestones to his father who is in the army and his father was present to watch him play. Jurel added that he is very proud to do it in front of him.Jurel said that he intended to finish the game and he backed his shots, adding that Sanju Samson calmed him down when he was struggling to time the ball initially and that helped him a lot.After a good 60-run partnership between Yashasvi Jaiswal and Jos Buttler , the Royals suffered a mini collapse as they lost three quick wickets.But skipper Samson steadied things along with Jurel with both of them scoring brilliant fifties and getting their side over the line with an over to spare.
Article Summary: Dhruv Jurel scores unbeaten 52 as Rajasthan Royals beat Lucknow Super Giants. JureL hit 2 sixes and 5 fours in his knock and put up 121-run stand with skipper Sanju Samson. Royals chased down the 197-run target with an over to spare in Lucknow.

Article Title: 'Only plan was to...': Tushar Deshpande after taking four-fer in Chennai Super Kings' win over Sunrisers Hyderabad
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Riding on captain Ruturaj Gaikwad 's 98, Daryl Mitchell's 52, and fast-bowler Tushar Deshpande 's impressive four-wicket haul, defending champions Chennai Super Kings snapped their two-game losing streak with a commanding 78-run victory over Sunrisers Hyderabad in Match 46 of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024 at the MA Chidambaram Stadium on Sunday.On a dry pitch, Gaikwad fell just two runs shy of becoming the second batter to score consecutive IPL centuries, while Mitchell achieved his maiden fifty in the tournament, guiding CSK to a substantial total of 212/3 in 20 overs.In response, SRH struggled to chase the target and were eventually bowled out for 134 in 18.5 overs, marking their second consecutive failure while batting second.Deshpande's three wickets during the powerplay contributed to his IPL-best figures of 4-22, leading CSK's outstanding bowling effort.After the win, Deshpande said CSK bowlers used the wicket well."When we came to bowl, the only plan was to have patience against SRH who are quite aggressive in the powerplay and that paid dividends for us. Bowling that length in the powerplay is crucial, even if I get hit, I always challenge the batter to hit that length again and it worked for me today," Deshpande, who claimed four wickets, said after the match."The ground was soaking wet, it swung for a couple of balls and then it did not. It was a bit sticky and I thought we used the pitch well. We had a specific plan - even if they hit a good ball, we will focus on our plans and not get carried away by them," the pacer said.Following the win, CSK moved to the third spot with 10 points, same as Kolkata Knight Riders, Lucknow Super Giants and Delhi Capitals. SRH, who are also on 10 points, slipped to fourth after their fourth loss.CSK will next face Punjab Kings on Wednesday.
Article Summary: Defending champions Chennai Super Kings beat Sunrisers Hyderabad by 78 runs. Captain Ruturaj Gaikwad scores 98, Daryl Mitchell 52, and Tushar Deshpande takes four wickets. CSK move to third spot with 10 points, same as Kolkata Knight Riders, Lucknow Super Giants and Delhi Capitals.

Article Title: 'I was upset...': Captain Ruturaj Gaikwad after Chennai Super Kings' big win over Sunrisers Hyderabad
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Tushar Deshpande's exceptional bowling in the powerplay proved to be a game-changer for the Chennai Super Kings in their 78-run victory over Sunrisers Hyderabad . Captain Ruturaj Gaikwad recognized that the pacer's performance infused the team with the momentum they had been lacking this season.Deshpande's spirited effort yielded figures of 4/27 in three overs, with three of those wickets coming during the powerplay, which dismantled the formidable SRH batting lineup spearheaded by Travis Head."One area where we lost momentum in a few games was not getting wickets in the powerplay. It is the only way we can put the opposition on the back foot. Deshpande bowled really well. His hard work is paying off," said CSK skipper Gaikwad, who scored 98 off 54 deliveries to give his team a 200-plus total to defend.With the dew giving spinners a torrid time, the onus was on Ravindra Jadeja to keep his line and length intact, and the wily spinner bowled a measly spell, giving away just 22 runs in his four overs while also taking a wicket."Special mention to Jaddu as well. In these wet conditions, four overs 20-25 runs, for me that was a match-turning spell."I'm not very vocal. Everyone is very experienced in the dressing room and you can't just go up to seniors and tell them what to do. So I just take a back seat," said Gaikwad following the win, which propelled CSK to third position on the points table.Gaikwad added that at no point in time was he thinking about a century, saying that he was "upset" with himself for missing a few big shots."I was never even thinking about the hundred. I was just trying to make sure we get to 220 or whatever extra runs possible. Even in the last game I wasn't thinking about the hundred."I was upset I missed a few shots. At the innings break I thought it would cost us. But in the end it worked out. Last game we made some errors, some loose balls here and there, not really up to the mark in the field. Today we came up with plans, stuck to them and we were excellent in the field."He said that with the 'impact sub' rule, no score is safe and the more a team scores the better it is."With the impact rule you never know the par score, you always want an extra 10-20 runs."
Article Summary: Chennai Super Kings beat Sunrisers Hyderabad by 78 runs. Tushar Deshpande took 4/27 in three overs. Ravindra Jadeja bowled 22 runs in his four overs. Captain Ruturaj Gaikwad scored 98 off 54 deliveries.

Article Title: 'Baby is on the way': Bua-to-be Sakshi Dhoni urges Chennai Super Kings to finish match fast
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Mahendra Singh Dhoni 's wife Sakshi on Sunday made a sweet and well-timed request to the Chennai Super Kings, which was met positively by the five-time champions.While cheering for the team from the stands at the Chepauk, Sakshi shared an Instagram story in which she asked the team to wrap up the game against Sunrisers Hyderabad quickly as she is expecting to become an aunt soon."Please finish the game fast today @chennaiipl. Baby is on the way... Contractions have begun. Request from - to be Bua," Sakshi's post read.Captain Ruturaj Gaikwad narrowly missed his second consecutive IPL century, while pacers Tushar Deshpande and Matheesha Pathirana dismantled the Sunrisers Hyderabad batting lineup as the Chennai Super Kings secured a 78-run victory.Gaikwad's 54-ball 98 and his 107-run partnership with Daryl Mitchell (52) helped CSK post a solid total of 212/3. Deshpande (4/27) and Pathirana (2/17) then delivered match-winning bowling performances, dismissing SRH for 134 in 18.5 overs.Deshpande took the wickets of opener Travis Head (13) and Anmolpreet Singh (0) in his first over, along with Abhishek Sharma (15) and captain Pat Cummins (5). Pathirana removed the dangerous Aiden Markram and Heinrich Klaasen, crushing SRH's batting line-up.With this decisive win, the five-time champions rose to third place in the points table.CSK now have 10 points, with 5 wins in 10 matches.Their next game will be against the Punjab Kings on Wednesday.
Article Summary: Mahendra Singh Dhoni's wife Sakshi asks Chennai Super Kings to finish the game quickly. She is expecting to become an aunt soon. CSK beat Sunrisers Hyderabad by 78 runs. Tushar Deshpande and Matheesha Pathirana took four wickets each.

Article Title: Nothing went right for us, says Pat Cummins after 78-run thrashing by CSK
Article Text: NEW DELHI: After bowlers conceded 212 in a traditionally slow Chepauk track, batters nosedived in the chase as Sunrisers Hyderabad succumbed to a heavy 78-run defeat against Chennai Super Kings on Sunday.After RCB brought back a high-flying Sunrisers down to the ground in the previous game, Pat Cummins and Co. suffered their second defeat in a row.After the defeat against CSK, the SRH skipper admitted they were outplayed and will look to come back stronger in next game."We thought chasing was our best chance to win but unfortunately it didn't come off tonight. I thought they obviously batted well but with our batting lineup, wicket was playing pretty well, so I thought we had a good chance. I think we are pretty happy with how the batting lineup is going. Nothing went right for us today but everyone in that lineup has won a game for us at some point this season, " said Cummins in the post-match presentation."It's definitely dewy now, but it was pretty dewy in the first innings as well. It's only a couple of games [lost], so we'll look to bounce back quickly," he added.Skipper Ruturaj Gaikwad's belligerent 98 was complemented by a clinical bowling display, led by pacer Tushar Deshpande, as the defending champions returned to winning ways with the fifth win of the season.Invited to bat, Gaikwad's valiant 54-ball knock was the driving force which propelled CSK to an imposing 212 for three. He was ably supported by Daryl Mitchell, who returned to form with a crucial 32-ball 52 before Shivam Dube's 20-ball 39 not out took CSK past the 200 mark.In response, SRH's ultra-cautious batting approach backfired again as they couldn't recover from Deshpande's (4/27 in 3 overs) three-wicket burst with the new ball and the middle-overs squeeze to be all out for 134 in 18.5 overs.
Article Summary: Sunrisers Hyderabad lose to Chennai Super Kings by 78 runs. CSK bowled out Sunrisers for 134 in 18.5 overs. Ruturaj Gaikwad top scored for CSK with 98. Pat Cummins says they will bounce back quickly.

Article Title: 'He can play all formats': Brett Lee hails Dhruv Jurel
Article Text: NEW DELHI: After the conclusion of the match between the Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) and the Rajasthan Royals (RR) in the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024, former Australian fast bowler Bret Lee praised young wicketkeeper-batter Dhruv Jurel for his outstanding performance in the 44th match of the ongoing 17th edition of the lucrative league.The Rajasthan Royals (RR) clinched a 7-wicket victory over the Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) at the Ekana Cricket Stadium on Saturday, thanks to an unbeaten, explosive 121-run partnership between Sanju Samson and Dhruv Jurel.RR captain Samson topped the scorecard for RR with an unbeaten 71 off 33, while Jurel delivered an impressive 52 off 34 balls. LSG's bowling struggled, exacerbated by multiple dropped catches.Lee emphasized Jurel's ability to excel across all formats, noting his skill in knowing when to accelerate during his innings. Jurel's unbeaten 52-run knock included five boundaries and two sixes."He's a quality batter, he's got proper cricket shots. He can play all formats of the game and knows when to go through the gears as needed. His shots are classy and have the power to go towards the cow corner. He shows his class and continues to grow in stature," Bret Lee was quoted as saying on Jio Cinema.Further, the former right-arm pacer spoke about the opening partnership between Jos Buttler and Yashasvi Jaiswal . Both batters put on a partnership of 60 runs in just 35 balls."The first wicket partnership, you can see, 60 off 35. When you've got someone like Jos Buttler, who likes to be aggressive, and Jaiswal on the other end, they complement each other beautifully. A left-hand and right-hand combination. The great thing about the Rajasthan Royals is that they've got the combination at the top of the order and also with the ball. They complement each other beautifully," the former Australian cricketer added.'He can play all formats': Bret Lee hails Dhruv Jurel
Article Summary: Bret Lee hails Dhruv Jurel after Rajasthan Royals' 7-wicket victory over Lucknow Super Giants. Former Australian fast bowler praises wicketkeeper-batter's ability to play all formats. Lee also praises opening partnership between Jos Buttler and Yashasvi Jaiswal.

Article Title: 'He's a legend of the game': Will Jacks hails Virat Kohli following RCB's crushing win over GT
Article Text:
(With ANI inputs)

NEW DELHI: RCB 's batting all-rounder Will Jacks showered praise on star batter Virat Kohli , hailing him as the "legend of the game." Their formidable unbeaten partnership of 166 runs off 74 balls during the IPL 2024 clash against Gujarat Titans showcased Kohli's mastery and leadership on the field.Kohli's authoritative innings of 70 not out from 44 deliveries, marked by 6 fours and 3 sixes, underscored his prowess as a batsman.Meanwhile, Jacks' explosive unbeaten century, scoring 100 runs from just 41 balls with an impressive strike rate of 243.90, highlighted his exceptional batting skills.Reflecting on their partnership, Jacks expressed admiration for Kohli, acknowledging him as a role model for cricketers worldwide. Jacks emphasised the invaluable learning experience gained from playing alongside the talismanic batter, indicating the profound impact of Kohli's mentorship on his cricketing journey.The right-handed batter added that he needs to be more "adaptable" at the start of his innings in the upcoming matches."It's amazing, he's a legend of the game and is someone everyone looks up to. To spend some time in the middle is a great feeling, a huge learning curve. When I go away from the IPL, I'll learn so much from batting with him and playing with him. I'll try to take it all on board. I need to be a bit more adaptable at the beginning of my innings and get myself in a little bit quicker," Jacks said.In the match, RCB won the toss and opted to field first. GT's Sai Sudharsan (84) andShahrukh Khan (58) put up a commendable performance, guiding their team to a total of 200/3. Despite a strong start by GT, RCB's bowlers struggled initially, with only Maxwell, Siraj, and Swapnil managing to take wickets.In response, RCB's run chase was led by Kohli (70*) and Jacks (100*), who steered their team to victory with a stellar partnership. RCB secured their third win of the season, defeating GT by 9 wickets. Sai Kishore was the lone wicket-taker for GT, dismissing Faf du Plessis in the fourth over.
Article Summary: Will Jacks hails Virat Kohli as the "legend of the game" RCB beat Gujarat Titans by 9 wickets in IPL 2024 clash. Kohli (70) and Jacks (100) scored 166 runs off 74 balls. RCB won the toss and opted to field first.

Article Title: 'Need Sher ka Jigar not Strike Rate': Mohammad Kaif hails Virat Kohli after RCB's third win
Article Text:
(With inputs from ANI)

NEW DELHI: Virat Kohli 's solid 44-ball 70 not out against Gujarat Titans in Ahmedabad on Sunday earned him high praise from former India batter Mohammad Kaif . Kohli's composed knock, alongside Will Jacks blitz, left the opposition stunned as the duo powered Royal Challengers Bengaluru to a commanding 9-wicket victory.Throughout this IPL , Kohli has consistently showcased his batting prowess and on Sunday reached the milestone of 500 runs for the seventh consecutive time in a season.Kaif's commendation of Kohli's performance came amidst recent criticism surrounding the star batter's strike-rate.Kohli's unbeaten 70 in the clash against Titans also effectively silenced his critics, demonstrating his ability to adapt and excel in various match situations.Kaif praised the experienced star and pinpointed the importance of Kohli by recalling the six that he struck in Haris Rauf's over during India's clash against Pakistan in the previous edition of the T20 World Cup.The fiery 166-run partnership between Virat Kohli and Will Jacks also etched the record books. It was the highest partnership scored against Titans in the history of the IPL. Rajasthan Royals' Sanju Samson and Riyan Parag's 130-run partnership holds second place on the highest partnership scored against the Gujarat-based side.Kohli also equalled David Warner's record of most 500-plus runs in IPL seasons. Both Kohli and Warner have crossed the 500-run mark seven times in an IPL season.Coming to the match, after putting GT to bat, Sai Sudharsan (86*) and Shahrukh Khan's (58) blitz powered the hosts to a competitive total of 200/3.In reply, after skipper Faf du Plessis's dismissal, Kohli and Jacks rattled GT's bowling unit with their 166*-run stand to clinch a 9-wicket win for RCB
Article Summary: Mohammad Kaif praises Virat Kohli for his unbeaten 70 not out against Gujarat Titans. Kohli and Will Jacks' 166-run stand was the highest partnership scored against Titans in the history of the IPL. The duo powered Royal Challengers Bengaluru to a 9-wicket victory.

Article Title: Ruturaj Gaikwad's bold 98 propels Chennai Super Kings to 212/3 against Sunrisers Hyderabad in IPL
Article Text:
(With PTI inputs)

NEW DELHI: Ruturaj Gaikwad fell just short of a consecutive century, but his brilliant innings powered Chennai Super Kings to a formidable total of 212 for three against Sunrisers Hyderabad in the Indian Premier League clash in Chennai.Gaikwad's commanding 98 off 54 deliveries set the tone for CSK's innings, supported by Daryl Mitchell 's crucial 52 off 32 balls and Shivam Dube 's explosive 39 not out off 20 deliveries.Gaikwad's aggressive stroke play, comprising 10 fours and three sixes, anchored CSK's innings after an early dismissal of opener Ajinkya Rahane .Gaikwad's fluent batting saw him reach his 17th IPL half-century in just 27 deliveries, laying a solid foundation for CSK.The partnership between Gaikwad and Mitchell proved pivotal, with both batsmen finding the boundaries consistently.Mitchell, after a slow start, accelerated to register his maiden IPL fifty off 29 balls before falling to Jaydev Unadkat .Shivam Dube's explosive cameo, combined with Gaikwad's determined effort, propelled CSK past the 200-run mark.Despite Gaikwad's dismissal in the final over, MS Dhoni and Dube ensured CSK finished strongly, adding 53 runs in the last four overs.Overall, Gaikwad's stellar knock and contributions from Mitchell and Dube laid the groundwork for CSK's commanding total.
Article Summary: Ruturaj Gaikwad scores 98 off 54 deliveries to power Chennai Super Kings to 212-3. Daryl Mitchell and Shivam Dube add 52 and 39 not out for CSK. MS Dhoni and Dube added 53 runs in the last four overs to finish strongly.

Article Title: 'Not able to pick up wickets in...': Shubman Gill decrypts Gujarat Titans' nine-wicket loss against RCB
Article Text:
(With ANI inputs)

NEW DELHI: After Gujarat Titans ' nine-wicket defeat against Royal Challengers Bengaluru in the Indian Premier League, skipper Shubman Gill analyzed the match and highlighted their failure to take wickets in the middle overs as a key factor in their loss.The GT bowlers had a lackluster performance, managing to take only one wicket during the second inning on Sunday.Gill himself had a modest innings, scoring 16 runs from 19 balls at a strike rate of 84.21. He struck just one boundary during his time at the crease.Speaking after the match, Gill praised the outstanding performances of Virat Kohli and Will Jacks against GT on Sunday. He emphasized the importance of devising improved strategies and plans for their upcoming matches in the tournament based on their learnings from this game."I think it was great hitting by them (Kohli and Jacks.) We need to come up with better plans in the next match, also need to execute them. When you are batting you can always think of scoring 15-20 runs more. We thought 200 was a good enough total for us, unfortunately, it didn't turn out the way we wanted it to. We were not able to pick up wickets in the middle overs, I think that was the turning point for us," Gill said.Recapping the match, RCB won the toss and decided to field against GT. Following this, Sai Sudharsan (84) and Shahrukh Khan (58) displayed a stellar performance to propel GT to 200/3.The RCB bowlers were sloppy in the opening of the game. Maxwell, Siraj, and Swapnil were the only wicket-takers for the visitors.During the run chase, Virat Kohli (70) and Will Jacks (100) handed RCB their third win of the season by beating GT by 9 wickets.Sai Kishore was the only wicket-taker for the GT after he dismissed Faf du Plessis in the fourth over.Following the win, RCB still stand in the bottom place on the IPL 2024 standings with six points. Meanwhile, GT hold the seventh place with 8 points after winning four of 10 matches.
Article Summary: Gujarat Titans lost to Royal Challengers Bengaluru by nine wickets on Sunday. Shubman Gill praised the outstanding performances of Virat Kohli and Will Jacks. GT bowlers had a lackluster performance, managing to take only one wicket.

Article Title: 'There is no help for bowlers': Mohammed Siraj blames smaller grounds and flat wickets
Article Text:
"Winning all games is the only possibility to qualify"

(With PTI inputs)

NEW DELHI: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) pacer Mohammed Siraj expressed frustration over the challenging conditions for bowlers in T20 cricket , lamenting the lack of assistance from smaller grounds and flat pitches.Siraj highlighted the trend of teams consistently surpassing the 250-run mark in this IPL season, a testament to the ultra-aggressive batting approach and the influence of the 'Impact player' rule.With batsmen capitalising on favourable conditions, bowlers face an uphill battle in containing high-scoring totals. Siraj's remarks shed light on the evolving dynamics of T20 cricket, where batsmen hold the upper hand in exploiting conducive playing surfaces to set daunting targets."See, nowadays cricket is really different, now 250-260 is made in every second match, earlier 250 was a rare thing," said Siraj after RCB overhauled the 201-run target set by Gujarat Titans in 16 overs in Ahmedabad."There is no help for bowlers, there are smaller grounds and flat wickets, there is no swing in the ball, so lots of changes. Bowlers can just keep playing and keep getting hit."Life has indeed been challenging for bowlers, particularly in this IPL season, as teams prioritise aggressive batting to maintain high run-rates throughout the innings, even beyond the powerplay overs."As a bowler, you have to keep the self-belief. I have seen lots of ups and downs in life, so I don't give up if 1-2 matches don't go my way. I look for a comeback," Siraj said."After one month, there is the World Cup... so I tell myself that if I get hit on a good ball, it is fine but I need to keep bowling less bad balls. I have not really bowled too badly this IPL, now 40 runs (in quota of four overs) is normal in T20 cricket."Siraj, with six wickets in nine IPL games this season, acknowledged the significant role of luck in T20 cricket."T20 is all about luck, you don't get a wicket with good balls and sometimes even a full toss gets you a wicket. so luck matters a lot. I keep working on my flaws during training."My mindset is always like I am the best bowler, when I go to the field, my attitude and mindset remains the same and it helps in my execution."Despite Gujarat Titans enduring their third loss in four games, Sai Sudharsan maintained that there are no glaring issues within the team. However, he emphasised the critical importance of winning all remaining matches to bolster their chances of qualifying for the playoffs."I don't think many things are going wrong. As a team we are doing well, definitely. It's just the result. If we had won this game, maybe many things would have been good. Getting better and just showing up (for) the next game is what is very important," said Sudharsan, who hit a 49-ball 84.GT are now at seventh place with eight points in the IPL standings."I think winning all the games is the only possibility which we can see. But I think taking it game by game, just getting better from this game. There were many positives from this game as well. Thinking of qualifying is a little longer. So, we just have to play the way we want."The left-handed batter said the pitch eased out with time which helped RCB chase down the target without much ado."Like 10-15 overs after when we were batting, it got a little better because when we started to play, the wicket was q little damp but eventually it got better under the lights. It remained the same, obviously, during the RCB's innings as well."
Article Summary: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) pacer Mohammed Siraj expressed frustration over the challenging conditions for bowlers in T20 cricket. Siraj highlighted the trend of teams consistently surpassing the 250-run mark in this IPL season. RCB overhauled the 201-run target set by Gujarat Titans in 16 overs.

Article Title: What happened in first leg doesn't matter, it starts 0-0: Kratky
Article Text: MUMBAI: The final minutes of Mumbai City 's first leg semifinal against FC Goa at Fatorda last week was effectively a microcosm of the Islanders' season.Trailing 2-0 until the final minute of regulation time, Petr Kratky's side demonstrated the resilience that has seen them make light of several setbacks over the course of the campaign. Like losing their head coach Des Buckingham who left the club to take over at hometown club Oxford United last November.Like losing key players like Greg Stewart and Rostyn Griffiths , who both parted ways with Mumbai City in January.Like signing Spanish striker Iker Guarrotxena in the January window, only to then lose him for the remainder of the season to a knee injury. Each time, Mumbai bounced back to ensure their league form didn't suffer and eventually only missed out on becoming the first team in the competition to defend the League Winners Shield after a gutting final-day loss to Mohun Bagan Super Giant in Kolkata.It was that same resilience that surfaced at a critical juncture last Wednesday, as Mumbai stunned the hosts with three late goals to snatch an incredible victory that has now put them in a favourable position to reach the Indian Super League final next Saturday.Ahead of Monday's return leg at the Mumbai Football Arena, Kratky, who took charge in December, spoke glowingly about the character of his team, but made it a point to play down their one-goal advantage."It wasn't easy, there were a couple of setbacks as everyone knows but we can be proud of ourselves how we have handled it and how we kept going," the Czech-Australian said at his pre-match press conference. "What I really like in this group is they stick together in hard times and push through it, so I'm very proud of every single one of them."That said, he was keen to remind his side about the importance of stepping onto the pitch on Monday with the right approach. "If you put it into perspective, we were losing 2-0 in 90 minutes, so everything certainly was not perfect. But we have addressed that," Kratky said."We know it will be a difficult game. Goa is a quality team. We have to respect that. But what happened last game, it doesn't matter. For me, it starts 0-0 and we have to go for the win."Goa coach Manolo Marquez admitted the manner in which his side saw their 2-0 lead turn into a 3-2 defeat inside six minutes had been tough to swallow, but the Spanish coach insisted the Gaurs would carry no psychological scars into the second leg."It's a process because it was a tough defeat and then it's normal to be very sad after the game. It was difficult to sleep that night, it was difficult the next day in the training session, Marquez said, adding: "I am completely sure that even if we did lose the last match, we will arrive in very good conditions mentally for the second leg."Mumbai won't be able to count on left back Akash Mishra who is injured, while Kratky said he was hopeful of having Spanish attacking midfielder Alberto Noguera available for selection. Goa, meanwhile, will badly miss the services of winger Mohammad Yasir who suffered an injury in the first leg.
Article Summary: Mumbai City beat FC Goa 3-2 in the first leg of their Indian Super League semifinal. Petr Kratky's side lead 2-0 until the final minute of regulation time at Fatorda. Goa coach Manolo Marquez insists his side will carry no psychological scars into second leg.

Article Title: Mohun Bagan brace for a 'final' before the final
Article Text: KOLKATA: Antonio Lopez Habas , the grand old man of Indian Super League , has deservedly earned his reputation as a manager who seems to have a trick up his sleeve, knowing how to produce the right performance for the right game.Mohun Bagan SG have been the undisputable beneficiary of the veteran Spaniard's Midas touch, having transformed themselves from a mid-season wobble to a late bloom, clinching the ISL Shield for the first time since the award was introduced five seasons ago.However, an engine which looked to be chugging along in first gear until a few days ago is now making some rattling noises. It is against this backdrop that Habas's team is preparing to face Odisha FC in the second leg of ISL semifinals at the Salt Lake Stadium on Sunday, having lost the first leg 1-2 in Bhubaneswar."It's not a semifinal, but the final for us," Habas told reporters before shepherding his team to the Salt Lake Stadium's practice ground on Saturday. "After winning the league, it's normal for players to relax sometimes. Two accidental moves and we lost the match in Odisha. There will be plans and tactical discussions. Now everything depends on what the players are going to do in the field," he added.Although Mohun Bagan are leading 4-1 on head-to-head count against Sunday's visitors with 5 games ending in stalemates, Odisha FC underSergio Lobera has emerged a pinprick in the Kolkata side's aspirations. Mohun Bagan failed to beat them in the league stage this season while Lobera's side came to stun them 5-2 at the Salt Lake Stadium on way to knock the green-and-maroon brigade out of the AFC Cup.Habas was not in charge of the team at that time, but Lobera did touch upon that AFC Cup result, emphasizing that his team is capable of silencing the vociferous Salt Lake Stadium crowd again."When you are playing in front of a lot of people in a stadium like this, full (stadium), (it) means you are playing for something important. I think it is a big motivation for me as a coach, for the players," Lobera said ahead of the latest clash between the two sides.With all tickets for Sunday's match already sold out, Mohun Bagan will certainly bank on home advantage to turn things around again - they pipped Mumbai City FC 2-1 to seal the league here two weeks ago. But Habas knows that Odisha can challenge them defensively.The visitors will miss Carlos Delgado, who scored the equalizer against Bagan in the first leg, but in Roy Krishna and Diego Mauricio they have two in-form strikers having scored 13 and 11 goals respectively. Krishna may be in the fag-end of his career in Indian club football, but the Fijian - who was developed into a lethal player during Habas's previous times at the Kolkata club - has shown remarkable consistency in influencing a match.While the duo will pose another test to the Bagan defence, Habas is set to demand more conviction and character from his team in turning the corner.In absence of suspended Armando Sadiku, Jason Cummings is set to start with Dimitri Petratos in the upfront but it's the presence of the likes of Manvir Singh and Liston Colaco on the width which becomes central to their attacking play."We have a chance to win the third trophy of the season (after the Durand Cup and ISL Winners' Shield). So, we'll treat it as a final and go at full blast against Odisha FC at home," Manvir said.
Article Summary: Mohun Bagan SG face Odisha FC in the second leg of ISL semifinals. Bagan lost the first leg 1-2 in Bhubaneswar. All tickets for Sunday's match have already been sold out. MohUn Bagan are leading 4-1 on head-to-head count against the visitors.

Article Title: LaLiga: Rodrigo De Paul, Angel Correa boost Atletico Madrid's UCL bid with goals in 3-1 win against Athletic Bilbao
Article Text:
(Inputs from AFP)

NEW DELHI: Atletico Madrid secured a crucial 3-1 victory against Athletic Bilbao in La Liga on Saturday, strengthening their grip on a Champions League spot. The win puts Simeone's team six points ahead of their Basque rivals, who sit in fifth place, with only five games left to play.Rodrigo De Paul opened the scoring for Atletico, and although Nico Williams equalized for Athletic shortly after being subjected to alleged racial abuse while taking a corner, further goals from Angel Correa and an Unai Simon own goal sealed the three points for the home side.The loss leaves Athletic, who recently triumphed in the Copa del Rey, with a slim chance of qualifying for the Champions League for the first time in ten years.In other La Liga action, Girona climbed to second place after a 2-0 away win at Las Palmas, putting them on the brink of Champions League qualification. Meanwhile, league leaders Real Madrid edged past Real Sociedad 1-0 on Friday, and third-placed Barcelona host Valencia on Monday.Before the match, Atletico supporters paid tribute to retiring Athletic forward Raul Garcia, who was part of their 2014 La Liga-winning squad. The game was briefly halted in the 36th minute due to apparent racial abuse directed at Athletic's Nico Williams as he prepared to take a corner.Moments later, Williams responded by scoring the equalizer, celebrating by tapping his arm in an apparent reference to his skin colour.Atletico regained the lead in the second half through Correa, who controlled Koke's chipped pass before calmly beating Simon. The hosts sealed the victory when Samuel Lino's low shot hit the post and deflected into the net off the back of goalkeeper Simon.
Article Summary: Atletico Madrid beat Athletic Bilbao 3-1 in La Liga on Saturday. The win puts Simeone's team six points ahead of their Basque rivals. Girona climb to second place after a 2-0 away win at Las Palmas.

Article Title: Lionel Messi nets twice in Inter Miami's win over New England Revolution; Luis Suarez also on scoresheet
Article Text:
(Inputs from AFP)

NEW DELHI: Lionel Messi 's scoring streak in MLS continued as he netted twice in Inter Miami 's 4-1 comeback victory against New England Revolution on Saturday. The league's top scorer now has nine goals in seven appearances this season.A massive crowd of over 65,612 spectators gathered at Gillette Stadium in Foxborough, Massachusetts, the venue shared by the Revolution and the NFL's New England Patriots, to witness the Argentine World Cup winner in action.Despite being affected by a flu outbreak and languishing at the bottom of the Eastern Conference, New England stunned the home fans just 40 seconds into the game through their own Argentine, Tomas Chancalay. After receiving a lofted pass from Spanish midfielder Carles Gil , Chancalay capitalized on Drake Callender's advanced position and chipped the ball over the stranded Miami goalkeeper to open the scoring.Messi equalized for Miami in the 32nd minute, latching onto Robert Taylor's through pass and calmly slotting the ball home. The eight-time Ballon d'Or winner then put Miami ahead in the 68th minute, collecting a brilliant defence-splitting pass from his former Barcelona teammate Sergio Busquets and finishing with his trademark composure.In the closing stages, Miami added two more goals, both orchestrated by Messi. Substitute Benjamin Cremaschi made it 3-1 in the 83rd minute, pouncing on the rebound after a Messi shot was parried away. Luis Suarez completed the scoring by finding the top corner following an inside pass from Messi.
Article Summary: Lionel Messi scores twice in Inter Miami's 4-1 victory against New England Revolution. Messi now has nine goals in seven appearances this season. A massive crowd of over 65,612 spectators gathered at Gillette Stadium in Foxborough, Massachusetts.

Article Title: Premier League round-up: Mohamed Salah's spat tops Liverpool draw; Chelsea, Manchester United drop points
Article Text:
(Inputs from AFP)

NEW DELHI: Liverpool 's Premier League title aspirations suffered a significant setback on Saturday as they were held to a draw by West Ham , while Sheffield United were relegated from the top-flight.In a day filled with drama, Aston Villa 's pursuit of a top-four finish was hindered by a 2-2 draw against Chelsea , whose manager Mauricio Pochettino expressed his frustration with VAR after a late goal was controversially disallowed.Manchester United 's European ambitions were stalled by a 1-1 draw against Burnley, and Everton secured their Premier League status with a 1-0 victory over Brentford at Goodison Park.Liverpool's chances of catching league leaders Arsenal took a hit as they dropped points for the fourth time in their last five league matches. Despite having opportunities to secure a win, they were unable to capitalize on them. The Gunners sit atop the table with 77 points, two ahead of Liverpool with a game in hand, while reigning champions Manchester City have 76 points with two games in hand on the Reds.Jarrod Bowen gave West Ham the lead just before halftime, but Liverpool showed improvement in the second half, equalizing through Andy Robertson before West Ham goalkeeper Alphonse Areola scored an own goal.However, the home side found an equalizer in the 77th minute when Bowen set up Michail Antonio for a headed goal, resulting in a 2-2 final score. Klopp tried to downplay a touchline disagreement with Mohamed Salah , who was left out of the starting lineup, but the Egyptian forward added fuel to the fire, saying, "There's going to be a fire today if I speak."
Article Summary: Liverpool held to a 2-2 draw by West Ham in the Premier League on Saturday. Everton secured their Premier League status with a 1-0 victory over Brentford. Aston Villa's pursuit of a top-four finish was hindered by a draw against Chelsea. Sheffield United were relegated from the top-flight.

Article Title: Arne Slot: Liverpool reach agreement for Jurgen Klopp's replacement to become new manager
Article Text:
(Inputs from AFP)

NEW DELHI: According to British media reports, Liverpool and Feyenoord have reached an agreement for Arne Slot to replace Jurgen Klopp as the manager of the Premier League club. The Press Association reported that a compensation package for the 45-year-old, who had two years remaining on his contract, has been agreed upon. The BBC stated that the deal is worth up to £9.4 million (10.9 million euros).Slot expressed his confidence in securing the Anfield job on Thursday, saying, "I would like to go to Liverpool.Now I'm waiting to see whether the clubs reach an agreement. I'm very confident in that." He joined Feyenoord in 2021 after an impressive stint as the manager of AZ Alkmaar. In his first season with Feyenoord, Slot led the team to the inaugural Europa Conference League final, where they narrowly lost 1-0 to Jose Mourinho's Roma. The following season, he guided the club to their second league title in 24 years before signing a new three-year contract.Klopp, who will step down at the end of the current season after a successful nine-year reign that included winning the Champions League in 2019 and the Premier League in 2020, praised Slot's qualities, saying, "I like the way his team plays football . If he is the one, I like that he wants it." He added, "I don't know him, but some people who know him say he's a good guy. I like that a lot. So good coach, good guy. Looking forward for the club, if he is the solution, if he is the man, I'm more than happy."Currently, Feyenoord sit second in the Eredivisie table, nine points behind leaders PSV Eindhoven. Failing to win the Dutch title would be a disappointment for Slot, similar to Klopp's frustration with Liverpool's faltering title bid. The Reds are third in the Premier League, three points behind leaders Arsenal and two points behind second-placed Manchester City, who have a game in hand. Liverpool's recent form has been poor, with defeats against Crystal Palace and Everton, as well as quarter-final exits in the FA Cup and Europa League.Initially, Bayer Leverkusen manager and former Liverpool midfielder Xabi Alonso was considered the favorite to succeed Klopp. However, Alonso has committed to staying at Leverkusen after leading them to a first-ever Bundesliga title. Sporting Lisbon coach Ruben Amorim was also linked with the Liverpool job but has reportedly held talks with West Ham about replacing David Moyes next season.Liverpool captain Virgil van Dijk believes that Slot's attacking tactics could be an ideal fit for the Premier League club, stating, "I think Arne Slot is perhaps one of the better Dutch coaches at this moment. I think the way of playing and the philosophy he has, that he could be a Liverpool coach."
Article Summary: Liverpool and Feyenoord have reached an agreement for Arne Slot to replace Jurgen Klopp. A compensation package for the 45-year-old, who had two years remaining on his contract, has been agreed upon. The BBC stated that the deal is worth up to £9.4 million (10.9 million euros)

Article Title: Arda Gueler's goal takes Real Madrid closer to their 36th LaLiga title
Article Text:
(Inputs from Reuters)

NEW DELHI: Arda Gueler 's goal secured a 1-0 victory for a heavily-rotated Real Madrid side against Real Sociedad on Friday, bringing the LaLiga leaders closer to their 36th Spanish title.With only five games left to play, Real Madrid now have 84 points, extending their lead over second-placed Barcelona to 14 points. Barcelona, who have a game in hand, will host Valencia on Monday.Carlo Ancelotti , Real Madrid's manager, made significant changes to the team that defeated Barcelona 3-2 on Sunday, resting key players such as Jude Bellingham and Toni Kroos in preparation for their upcoming Champions League semi-final against Bayern Munich .Despite the changes, Ancelotti's team managed to secure the three points. "It was clear that everyone thought we were coming here for a walk," Ancelotti told reporters. "The only ones who didn't think so were the players. They had commitment and attitude. They had the desire and enthusiasm to keep winning."Real Sociedad, currently in sixth place and vying for a Europa League spot, controlled possession throughout the match, which was played in heavy rain. They created several good opportunities, but Real Madrid goalkeeper Kepa Arrizabalaga made crucial saves to keep them at bay.The visitors capitalized on their only chance in the first half when Gueler, a 19-year-old Turkish midfielder making his first start for Real Madrid since joining from Fenerbahce, converted Dani Carvajal's cross in the 29th minute. Three minutes later, Takefusa Kubo thought he had equalized for Real Sociedad, but the goal was disallowed after a VAR check revealed a foul in the build-up.In the second half, Real Sociedad continued to press for an equalizer, but they had another goal ruled out due to Mikel Merino being offside. Benat Turrientes also had a shot from the edge of the box saved by the impressive Arrizabalaga. Real Madrid nearly doubled their lead late in the game, but Alex Remiro made a fantastic reflex save to deny Eduardo Camavinga's close-range effort.Ancelotti praised his team's mentality, stating, "We have a spectacular squad. They have this attitude that they feel like they have to win every game. There are four points left to clinch the LaLiga title and we are very close."
Article Summary: Real Madrid extend lead over Barcelona to 14 points with 1-0 win over Real Sociedad. Arda Gueler scored the only goal of the game in the 29th minute. Carlo Ancelotti rested key players such as Toni Kroos and Jude Bellingham.

Article Title: Rafael Nadal secures straight-set win over Alex de Minaur at Madrid Open, sends warning amid recovery
Article Text:
(Inputs from AFP)

NEW DELHI: Rafael Nadal emerged victorious against Alex de Minaur in a 7-6 (8/6), 6-3 match at the Madrid Open on Saturday, reversing his recent loss to the Australian in Barcelona.Despite the win, the 22-time Grand Slam champion acknowledged that he still "needs time" to reach his peak competitive form. The match, attended by notable figures such as King Felipe VI of Spain, Zinedine Zidane, and Vinicius Junior, showcased Nadal's determination to overcome his physical challenges."No, not yet.It needs time," said Nadal on court. "To play over two hours means a lot to me and the atmosphere here is just a joke."Just step by step and let's see how I recover."Nadal, a five-time Madrid champion, stated that his decision to participate in the French Open will depend on his performance in Rome next week. The key factor, he explained, is his ability to compete at a high level and maintain his fighting spirit on the court.In other matches, Stefanos Tsitsipas suffered an unexpected second-round defeat against qualifier Thiago Monteiro, while top seed Jannik Sinner maintained his unbeaten record against fellow Italians by defeating Lorenzo Sonego.Daniil Medvedev also advanced to the third round after a hard-fought victory over Matteo Arnaldi.In the women's draw, defending champion Iga Swiatek comfortably defeated Sorana Cirstea to secure a fourth-round berth against Sara Sorribes Tormo. Ons Jabeur , the 2022 champion, staged an impressive comeback against Leylah Fernandez, while Coco Gauff overcame a shaky start to defeat Dayana Yastremska in straight sets.
Article Summary: Rafael Nadal beats Alex de Minaur 7-6 (8-6), 6-3 at Madrid Open. Nadal says he still needs time to reach peak competitive form. Stefanos Tsitsipas loses to qualifier Thiago Monteiro in second round.

Article Title: 'I can't imagine tennis without Rafael Nadal': Carlos Alcaraz
Article Text:
(Inputs from AFP)

NEW DELHI: Carlos Alcaraz acknowledged the immense impact Rafael Nadal has had on the sport of tennis during a press conference at the Madrid Open on Friday.The young Spaniard, who is the defending champion at the tournament, expressed his admiration for his legendary compatriot, emphasizing the difficulty of envisioning the tennis world without Nadal's presence."I don't want to imagine it yet. Like any Rafa fan, like any tennis fan, no one wants to imagine the tour without Rafa," said the 20-year-old Alcaraz.Nadal, who will turn 38 in June, has been limited to only a few appearances since the beginning of 2023, primarily due to a persistent hip injury that has hindered his ability to compete consistently.Alcaraz further expressed his desire to cherish every moment Nadal steps on the court, recognizing the 22-time Grand Slam champion 's unwavering dedication to the sport. "Personally, I want to make the most of Rafa, every time he steps on the court, whenever he can play."The young prodigy also acknowledged Nadal's relentless work ethic and competitive spirit, stating, "I know that's what he wants, that's what he craves, and that he works for it day in, day out to feel competitive, to be able to go out on the court and try to win."Looking ahead, Nadal is set to face Australia's Alex De Minaur in the second round of the Madrid Open on Saturday. De Minaur recently defeated Nadal in the Barcelona tournament last week.
Article Summary: Carlos Alcaraz acknowledged the immense impact Rafael Nadal has had on the sport of tennis during a press conference at the Madrid Open on Friday. The young Spaniard expressed his admiration for his legendary compatriot, emphasizing the difficulty of envisioning the tennis world without Nadal's presence.

Article Title: Rafael Nadal begins Madrid farewell with victory
Article Text:
(With AFP inputs)
